podcastContent: 敦煌壁画常常画这张画，就是维摩诘和文殊的对话。但我自己喜欢这一部经，常常抄这一部经，所以我觉得里面的对话好精彩。因为文殊菩萨进来了，到了病房就问说，诶，你是一个修行的人，那修行的人怎么会生病呢？你不是应该修行的这个程度已经很高了，你应该到了不生病的状况。那维摩诘就回答说：从师有爱，则我病生八个字，我常常写这8个字送朋友，我们知道痴情的痴这个字，就是理应知道不应该做的事，可是我情不自禁，我还是会做，从痴有爱，那我们也觉得很有趣，菩萨到底应不应该有爱，如果有爱是不是也有恨。就我觉得他触碰到大乘佛学非常惊人的部分，就从痴有爱则我病生，所以我生病，那文殊菩萨就问他，那你什么时候病会好。他说一切众生病好，我的病也就好。这个时候我们忽然发现维摩诘讲的病，不是一般的病，是说他承担了所有众生之病，我们知道这是大乘佛学。我们有一天知道一个人的修行到一定的程度，那个不关心是因为他有更高的关心。他会看到所有在现实里的争吵之上，应该有一个更为亲明的东西。所以我们常读到无无明，对无明的一种堪悟，能够有更大的了悟的可能。这是为摩皆经一直要传达的。

analysis.contentEssence: 以“病”为慈悲的容器：从情爱的牵连而生病，并将个人病痛扩展为对众生苦的共同承担与觉悟。
analysis.physicalMetaphor: 一盏灯芯被油浸透后微微发热冒烟：热与烟不是故障，而是把周围的冷与暗一起吸纳进来，直到整间屋子被照亮才渐渐平息。
analysis.metaphorVisualization: 画面中心是一个小而稳定的“灯芯/火种”形体，外圈是被吸入的半透明烟雾与热晕，呈向心汇聚后再缓慢淡出的层叠；烟雾的形不是分区对照，而是围绕核心的“病相”与“光相”共存。

tension.from: “修行人为何会病”的表层矛盾与情爱牵连
tension.to: 以病承载众生之病、以觉悟照见更大的关心

topologicalLayout.zoneCountReason: physicalMetaphor 是“灯芯+热晕烟雾”的同一系统：病与慈悲在同一中心里发生，不需要拆成多个对立区域。
topologicalLayout.divisionMethodReason: 热晕与烟雾天然以中心向外扩散/回旋，最贴合“从一念痴爱而生病、又承担众生苦”的向心—外放结构。

primaryRelationship.typeReason: 灯芯被热晕与烟雾层层包裹，象征“以自身为容器承载众生之病”，不是并列对照而是内外含摄。

rhythmSignature.typeReason: 从“冒烟发热”的扰动逐渐收束为稳定光源，呼应“众生病好，我病亦好”的渐息与回归澄明。

structureParams.tensionExpression: 中心光核保持清晰小尺度稳定形；外层烟雾以半透明回旋纹理制造“病相扰动”；烟雾密度由外向内递减并在最外缘淡出，形成“承担—照见—平息”的张力轨迹。

antiTemplateCheck.howIsThisDifferent: 整体是单域向心的“灯芯被烟雾包裹并渐息”的动态隐喻，用嵌套与层叠表达病与慈悲同体，而非把概念切成两个并列阵营做左右对比。

prompt:
[CANVAS]
- Format: 1:1 square, 1024x1024 pixels
- Safe margin: 10% padding on all sides (no important marks beyond this)
- Whitespace target: 65%+ (large calm field)
- Visual weight distribution: a tiny, crisp center kernel with very light, radial outward veils; most mass stays near center, dissolving toward the rim

[TOPOLOGY] — based on topologicalLayout
- Zone count: 1 (one continuous field, no splits)
- Division method: radial (all structure emanates from a single center)
- Zone ratios: 100
- Physical metaphor visualization: the entire image behaves like one lamp system—wick at the core, heat-halo and smoke as concentric/spiraling veils expanding outward and fading into the same background space

[RELATIONSHIPS] — based on primaryRelationship
- Primary relationship type: nested
- Interaction quality: fused (layers feel like one phenomenon, not separate objects)
- Spatial expression: place a small central wick-shape; surround it with three larger nested smoke/heat veils that partially overlap and melt into each other via transparency (no hard boundaries between layers)

[RHYTHM] — based on rhythmSignature
- Rhythm type: decelerating
- Element count: 4 total nested elements (1 core + 3 surrounding veils, or 1 core + 3 smoke layers; total shapes must be 4)
- Interval/size variation: gaps between layers increase outward (tight near the core, wider toward the edge); opacity decreases outward; outermost layer fades out before reaching the safe margin

[GEOMETRY]
- Primary shape: a tiny vertical teardrop/short wick mark at exact center, about 3–5% of canvas width, softly rounded tip, stable and crisp
- Secondary shapes (3): three nested, imperfect circular-oval veils suggesting smoke swirl (not perfect rings), each veil slightly offset by a few pixels to imply gentle rotation; keep them centered overall to preserve radial topology
- Lines: none (avoid illustrative strokes)
- Edge treatment: soft gradient-fade edges; no sharp outlines; the core wick can be the sharpest element but still smooth
- Negative space: uninterrupted; no panels, no diagonals, no left-right contrast blocks

[COLOR]
- Background: cool-mist (#F5F7FA)
- Primary hue (all shapes): moon-white (#F0F4F8), value ~95%, saturation kept under 32%
- Secondary hue: none (monochrome)
- Temperature: cool, clear Prajñā bias; implement warm-cool contrast only via subtle temperature shift inside gradients (very faint warmth in the inner glow while the field stays cool)
- Contrast method: layering through transparency (3 depth layers)
- Accent usage: none; if any ‘wake-up’ presence is needed, express it only as a 10–15% opacity micro-variation within moon-white, limited to 2–5% area, still reading as the same hue

[LIGHTING]
- Light source: implied inner heat from the wick
- Glow effects: exactly 2 very subtle glows/gradient halos—(1) a small inner heat halo hugging the wick, (2) a broader, faint halo that dissolves into the background; both remain extremely soft and understated
- Ambient atmosphere: high-key paper-light, calm clarity, no dramatic spotlight

[TEXTURE & MATERIAL] — degree micro-adjustments
- Surface quality: smooth, paper-like, minimal grain (almost flat)
- Edge sharpness: predominantly soft; center slightly clearer for ‘insight’ without adding new structure
- Transparency: three-layer depth; outer veil lowest opacity, fading out at edges

[ATMOSPHERE & MOOD]
- Japanese aesthetic: Ma (expansive silence), Kanso (few elements), Shibui (quiet depth)
- Content resonance: trembling compassion contained within one light—smoke as ‘illness’ that becomes a gentle, settling illumination rather than a problem

[STYLE]
- Render style: clean vector-like digital art, high clarity at 128px thumbnail
- No photorealism, no 3D rendering, no text, no symbols, no UI elements, no compositional splitting
